definition: medication/herbal remedy
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]
to treat/to cure/therapy

sentences.english: Objective To understand the status of perceiving of self-medication among university students.
sentences.chinese: 目的了解大学生自我药疗认知情况。

sentences.english: Sometimes CBT and medications are used in combination.
sentences.chinese: 有时候CBT和药疗被混合使用。

sentences.english: Today I'm on medication to control my emotional ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我用药疗来控制情绪上的起落。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the efficacy of four-step acupuncture and medicine therapy for treatment of genual osteoarthritis.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察四步针药疗法治疗膝骨性关节炎的疗效。

sentences.english: Food is homologous with the birth of the medication.
sentences.chinese: 食疗是与药疗同源诞生的。

definition: food therapy/treatment via food (TCM)
acupuncture and moxibustion/to give or have acupuncture and moxibustion
tonic food (food considered to be particularly healthful)/to eat such foods
natural therapy
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
(traditional) Chinese medicine/CL:服[fu4],種|种[zhong3]
medicinal cuisine
physiotherapy/physical therapy
traditional Chinese medical science/a doctor trained in Chinese medicine
to nurse one's health/to recuperate/to take care of/to look after/to discipline/to educate/to train/to prepare food/(dialect) to make fun of/(medicine) to opsonize
lit. food and medicine come from the same source (idiom)/fig. there is no clear-cut distinction between food and medicine
health protection/health care/to maintain in good health
physiotherapy
to maintain good health/to raise a child or animal/curing (of concrete etc)
tonic
the benefits of medicine are not as great as those of good nutrition
pinyin: yao4 bu3 bu4 ru2 shi2 bu3
